eng: This is a fat king.
The fat king has a thin dog.The fat king and his thin dog go for a walk.
The dog sees a bird.The dog runs after the bird.
The king runs after the dog.
They run and run.They run and run for many days.
The king catches the dog.
Now the fat king is thin.
Now the fat king is thin.
kha: Une u dei u Syiem uba sngaid

U Syiem uba sngaid u don ia u ksew uba raikhoh.
U Syiem uba sngaid bad u ksew uba raikhoh ki ia leit iaid kai.

U Ksew u iohi ia ka sim.
U Ksew u beh ia ka sim.
U Syiem u beh nadien jong u ksew.
Ki ia mareh sted bha. Ki ia mareh kumta shi kumta bun bun sngi.
U Syiem u lap ia u Ksew.
Mynta u Syiem uba sngaid u lah raikhoh.
☺️Lah kut﻿

eng: When the last school bell rang, all the children laughed and screamed with joy.                                                    All, except Akku. Akku was ANGRY!
"Akku! Akku! Look at the pretty sunflowers!" said Appa, as they rode   through a field."Oh no! They’re TOO YELLOW! They’re making my eyes hurt!" said Akku.
Akku! Akku! Look! Look at all the monkeys!" said Appa, pointing at the roof of their house.                              "oh no!" said Akku. Go AWAY!

"Here, drink some buttermilk," said Appa. "It’ll cool you down.""NO!" said Akku. "I DON’T WANT ANY!""Try a sip, at least?""OKAY! FINE!" said Akku, and tried a sip.It wasn’t all that bad.She had another sip.  And another.In no time, the glass was empty.

"Would you like a vada?" asked Appa.  "NO" said Akku."Just one little bite?""Okay, FINE!" said Akku, and took a bite. It  was quite good.She took another bite.And another.In no time, the plate was empty.

"Good girl," said Appa. "Now will you tell me why you’re so angry?"    "NO!" said Akku."Was it something I did?""NO!""Was it something Amma did?""NO!""Did something happened in school today?"     "MAYBE!"        "Oho."

"Would you like to draw it?" asked Appa. "Here’s a nice sheet of paper and some crayons."                                                                                                                                     "Okay, FINE!" said Akku.
Akku drew a brick… "This is the BRICK that I tripped over this morning," said Akku.                   "You’re right. That is a  brick!" said Appa.
And Akku drew a boy…"This is Bikku, The BOY who laughed at me when I fell down!" said Akku.                 "You’re right," said Appa. "He shouldn’t have laughed at you."
And Akku drew an idli…    "This is my idli," said Akku. "It fell out of my lunch box when I tripped over the BRICK!"

And Akku drew a crow…                                              "This is the CROW that flew off with my idli," said Akku.                              "The crow must have been very hungry," said Appa.

And Akku drew her teacher…"This is my teacher, Amala Miss," said Akku."She helped me up when I fell down. And then she hugged me.""That’s nice of her," said Appa."And then she patted my back and said, you would be fine. I DON’T like to be hugged and patted."Are you alright now?" I’m okay now."     "That’s good."

"See how well you draw, Akku?" said Appa."You’re a real artist! Will you draw something for Amma too?""Okay!" said Akku, and      started drawing some more. "This is a little white mouse… and this is a boat…and this is a coconut tree…"

"And this is a sunflower…and this is your cycle, Appa… and this is a dog…and this is a frog…"In no time, Akku had forgotten all about the BRICK that made her trip and fall. And about the BOY who laughed at her. And about the IDLI-CROW.And Akku even forgot about being ANGRY.

10 Things to Do If You Feel ANGRY like Akku:1. Laugh loudly and jump around with your arms in the air!2. Slowly – very, very slowly – breathe in, and breathe out!3. Drink some water! Or buttermilk!4. Eat a piece of fruit! Or a vada!5. Tell a grown-up about how you’re feeling!6. Write about how you’re feeling!7. Draw it out! Paint it!8. Play with a pile of clay!9. Make up a song about your anger! Sing it aloud!10. Do the happy dance!
kha:
Haba lah tied ka baje khatduh, ka skul ka lah wai bad baroh ki khynnah ki ia rkhie bad ki ia risa da ka jingkmen.
Baroh, hynrei tang i Akku.I Akku i lah dom palat!

"Akku! Akku! Peit kitei ki syntiew sngi kiba itynnad!" la ong i papa jong i, katba ki dang ia iaid lyngba ka lyngkha.
"GRRMPH" Ki stem palat! Lah pang sa ki khmat jong nga! "la ong i Akku.

"Akku! Akku! Peit! Peit ia kitai ki shrieh!" la ong i papa jong i,
I da kdew sha ka tnum jong ka iing jong ki. "SHISH!" la ong i Akku. "Phet! Phet shatai! Phet!"

"Shim, dih noh da kane ka dud," la ong i papa,. "Kan pyn jai jai ia phi."
"Ufff! La ong i Akku." Ngam kwah dih! "
" Pyrshang dih khyndiat? "
" To! NGAN DIH! "la ong i Akku, bad i lah dih khyndiat.

"Phin bam noh da u Vada? Kylli i papa.
" ynnai! "la ong i Akku.
" Bam tang khyndiat? "
" To ngan bam! la ong i Akku, bad i lah bam.

"Issh khynnah tipsngi," la ong i papa. "Mynta to iathuh ia nga kein balei phi dom haduh katne katne?"
"Ynnai!" la ong i Akku.
"Hato dei ba nga leh eiei ma nga?"
"Em!" 
"Hato dei ba leh eiei i meimei?"
"Em!"
"Ka jia eiei ka ba sniew ha skul mynta ka sngi?
" THARAI"
"Oh kumta mo". "

"Phi kwah ban dro ia kata ka jingjia?" la ong i papa. "Shim kane ka kot sada bad kine ki let rong. *
" To, NGAN DRO! "la ong i Akku.

I Akku i lah dro ia u mawit...
"Une u dei u Mawit uba nga jynthut mynne mynstep,u mawit uba bieit" la ong i Akku.
"Hooid u mawit uba bieit!" la ong i papa.

Nangta i Akku i dro ia uwei u khynnah...
"Une u dei u Bikku, u khynnah dakaid! U rkhie bein ia nga ha ka por ba nga ur!" la ong i Akku.
"Phi ong ia kaba dei," la ong i papa. "Um dei ban rkhie bein ia phi."

Bad i Akku i dro u Idli...
"Une u dei u Idli jong nga," la ong i Akku. "U hap na ka tiphin jong nga ha ka por ba nga jynthut ha uta u mawit uba bieit!"

Nangta i Akku i lah dro ia ka tyngab...
"Kane ka dei ka tyngab kaba sniew bha ka rong noh ia u Idli jong nga," la ong i Akku.
"Kata ka tyngab ka lah thngan bha tharai," la ong i papa

Bad i Akku i lah dro ia i nonghikai jong i...
"Ine i dei i nonghikai jong nga, i Miss Amala," la ong i Akku. I iarap ia nga ha ka por ba nga ur. Bad i kdup ia nga"
"I miss jong phi te iba bha,"lah ong i papa
" Bad i shyit ia ki ngab jong nga. NGAM SNGEWTYNNAD lada don ba shyit ia ki ngab jong nga"
"Oh! Phi lah pang?"
"Nga lah pang hi khyndiat. Tangba ngam lei lei shuh mynta."
"Oh biang kata."

"Peit katno jingitynnad kane ka jingdro jong phi, Akku? La ong i papa
Phi dei shisha i nongdro i ba triem bha! Phin dro na ka bynta i mei ruh?"
"Hooid ngan dro!" la ong i Akku bad i lah sdang ban dro ia kiwei pat ki jingdro. "Ine dei i khnai rit iba lieh.. Bad kane ka dei ka lieng... Baf une u dei u dieng snepkor.."

"Une u dei u syntiew sngi... Bad kane ka dei ka cycle jong phibpapa... Une u dei u ksew... Bad kane ka dei ka jakoid..." 
Tang shiphang hi, i Akku i lah klet shaphang uta u mawit uba i jynthut. Bad shaphang uto u khynnah dakaid uba rkhie bein ia i. Bad shaphang kato ka tyngab kaba tuh ia u Idli jong i. 
Bad i Akku i lah klet wat ia ka jingdom jong i ruh.

10 tylli kiei kiei ba phin leh lada phi dom:
1. Rkhie jam bad kynthih da rah ia ki kti jong phi sha jrong bad kaweh!
2. Suki-suki jai-ring bad pynhiar mynsiem!
3. Dih khyndiat ka um! Lane dih da ka dud!
4. Bam da u soh! Ne u Vada!
5. Iathuh ia i mei mei bad papa ne iano iano kiba lah san shaphang ka jingsngew jong phi.
6. Thoh ia ki jingsngew jong phi!
7. Dro ia ki! Ai rong ai rup!
8. Leh kai da ka dew byrtha!
9. Shna jingrwai shaphang ka jingdom jong phi!Rwai jam ia kata!
10. Shad kum u shrieh!

eng:
Here
are Dadi's red chillies, don't touch them!

Aha,
Bholu is cutting purple brinjals.

Rani Didi has sunshineyellow
lemons.

Colours are fun to see. Now to
eat something colourful too! Yummy! Should we eat a pink chuski?

We can drink tangy green
jaljeera.

Green on the outside,pink
inside, with pure white salt and red chilli powder!
kha: Kine ki dei ki sohmynken saw jong i Meikha,wat nym ktah ia ki!
Aha, i Bholu i dang ot sohbaingon basaw bthuh.
I kongkong Rani i don ki sohjew kiba shai stem.
Ki rong ki long kiba sngewbha ban ia peit kai. Mynta ngin ia bam kaei kaei ba don rong ruh! Ia ngin ia bam i chuski ba rong pink?
Ngi lah ban dih ka jingdih jira ba khlain bad ba jyrngam.
Jyrngam nabar, pink napoh, bad ka mluh kaba lieh kaba shida, bad u powdar sohmynken saw.

eng: For the very first time, Maaloo is collecting vegetables from the garden. He has collected red tomatoes, fresh brinjals and green lady's fingers.
Maaloo looked at all the trees, creepers and plants. Not a single potato could he see.
“Dadi, the potatoes aren’t ready yet,” said Maaloo, putting the empty basket down. “No Maaloo, there are plenty of potatoes. Look carefully,” said Dadi.
Maaloo went into the garden once more. Kaaloo followed him. Maaloo was looking for potatoes when he heard, “Woof! Woof!”
“Kaaloo! Stop, Kaaloo!” yelled Maaloo, running behind him. “Don’t spoil the garden.” Maaloo saw that Kaaloo was digging away and what do you think was coming out of the mud?Big fat potatoes!
“Well done, Kaaloo. You found the potatoes!” laughed Maaloo, filling his basket with potatoes.
kha: Haka sien kaba nyngkong eh. i Maaloo i dang kheit jhur na ka kper. I lah kheit ki sohsaw kiba saw, ki sohbaingon kiba i bha bad ki byndi kiba jyrngam.
I Maaloo i peit ia baroh ki dieng, ki siej, bad ki jingthung. Um don iwei ruh i phan ba i lah ban iohi.
"Meirad, ki phan kim pat long ban kheit," la ong i Maaloo, haba i buh ia ka shang ka bym don eiei ha madan."Em Maaloo, ki don bun ki phan. Peit bha," la ong i Meirad.
I Maaloo i leit biang sha ka kper sa shisien. I Kaaloo ruh i bud ia i. I Maaloo i dang wad ia ki phan haba i iohsngew, ka jingwiar ksew!

"Kaaloo! Sangeh, Kaaloo!" i hala i Maaloo, haba i dang mareh nadien. "Wat pynduh iaka kper." I Maaloo i la iohi ba i Kaaloo i dang tih bad phi tharai i iohi aiu ba mih nabar ka ktieh? Ki phan baheh ba sngaid!
"Ish, Kaaloo. Phi la ioh iaki phan!" i rkhie i Maaloo, haba i pyndap iaka shang jong i da ki phan.

eng: The painters were busy. One painter was on a ladder. Another was hanging from the roof on a swing. “Can we help?” asked Veena and Vinay.
The painter gave each of them a brush. “Paint the inside of the gate,” he said to Veena. “Paint the outside of the gate,” he said to Vinay.
The paint fell on the ground. The paint fell on the wall. The paint fell on them.
At last they finished. They wiped off the paint that had splashed on the ground. They wiped off the paint that had splashed on the wall.
“Oh, you have made a two-coloured gate!” cried the painter. “Let us keep it that way!” said Mother.
kha: Ki nongñiad rong ki bunkam. Iwei i nongñiad rong i don haka jingkieng dieng. Iwei pat i sdien na ka sat jong ka sohpadoi. "Long ngin iarap?" kylli i Veena bad Vinay.
U nongñiad rong u ai iwei i brut iaki baroh arngut. "Ñiad iaka ba hapoh ka phalor," u ong ia Veena."Ñiad iaka habar ka phalor," u ong ia Vinay.
Ka rong ka hap hapoh madan.Ka rong ka hap ha ka kynroh,Ka rong ka hap ha ki.
Haba khatduh ki la ia dep. Ki sa ñiad iaka rong ba la hap ha madan. Ki ñiad iaka rong ba la hap ha kynroh.
"Oh, peit phi la shna ka phalor ba ar rong!" ong u nongñiad rong."Ia ngin iabuh beit iaka kumto!" ong i Mei.

eng: Susheela resides in Tamilnadu. She learnt to draw Kolams  from her mother.
kha: I Susheela i sah ha Tamil Nadu. I tip ban dro kolam na i Mei jong i.

eng: It's not easy being a tiger.Yes, tigers are beautiful and fierce.
But tigers are also big and heavy.This makes it difficult for them to hunt for food.
Out of every twenty times a tiger hunts,it eats only once.
When a tiger moves through the forest,KHAU! KHAU! KHAK!The langur calls, just like an old man coughing!KHAU! KHAU! KHAK!
AWOOOO! HAWOOOO!The barking deer calls, like a scared dog!AWOOOO! HAWOOOO!
OOW! OOW! OOW!The spotted deer calls, like a little bird!OOW! OOW! OOW!
The whole forest knows the tiger is here!AHUUUN? AHUUUN?The tiger wonders, where has everyone gone?
kha: Kam long kaba suk ban dei u khla,Hooid, ki khla kilong kiba itynnad bad kiba dom.
Hynrei ki khla kilong ruh kiba heh bad kiba khia.Kane ka pynjynjar ia ki ban wad iaka jingbam.
Shisien na ka arphew sien ba u khla u leit wad jingbam,u ioh bam tang shisien.
Haba u khla u iaid ha ka khlaw, KHAU! KAHU! KHAK!U Shrieh u khot, kum u tymmen briew ba jyrhoh! KHAU! KHAU! KHAK!

AWOOOO! HAWOOOO!Ka skei ka khot, kum u ksew uba sheptieng! 

AWOOOO! HAWOOOO!

OOW! OOW! OOW!ka skei ka khot, kum i sim barit! 

OOW! OOW! OOW!
Baroh kawei ka khlaw ka lah tip ba u khla u lah don hangne! AHUUUN? AHUUUN?U Khla u pyrkhat, shaei baroh ki la leit?

eng:

eng: One day, Gauri, the cow, asked him, “Bheema, why are you so sad?”Bheema said, “I cannot get up early and Ramu shouts at me every day. Will you wake me up every morning, please?”“Yes, I will,” said Gauri. Early next morning, Gauri mooed loudly, but Bheema did not wake up.

Coming back from the river in the evening, Bheema met Moti, the dog.“I can never get up in the morning on time. Will you wake me up?” Bheema asked Moti.“Yes, I will,” said Moti and the next morning he barked and barked but did Bheema did not wake up.

That evening Bheema met Cheenu, the rooster.He said to Cheenu, “You crow in the morning and everybody wakes up. Will you wake me up too?” Cheenu agreed. The next morning, Cheenu crowed long and loud, but Bheema did not wake up.

The next evening, Bheema saw Kalu, the crow, cawing away happily.“Kalu, will you wake me up in the morning, please?” he asked.Kalu said, “Why not? I will caw and wake you up.”The next morning Kalu cawed all he could but Bheema did not wake up.
Bheema was sad.The next morning, a fly came and sat on his nose.“Aaah…chhoooo… ahchhoo!” Bheema got up with a big sneeze.

“Wow! I woke up. How did I wake up?” he asked in wonder.“I woke you up,” said the fly.“Will you wake me up like this early every morning?” “Sure,” said the fly. Bheema was happy. Now he would have no problem getting up early every morning!
kha: Ha kawei ka sngi, ka masi ba kyrteng Gauri, ka kylli ia i,"Bheema, balei phi sngewsih?"I Bheema i ong, "Ngam lah ban khie dang step bad i Ramu i hala ia nga man ka sngi. Sngewbha, long phin kyrsiew ia nga man ka step?" "Hooid toa," ong i Gauri. Ha ka sngi ba bud, mynstep, I Gauri i pah jam bha, hynrei i Bheema i khlem khie.

? No Sir!Haba i dang wan na ka wah por janmiet, i Bheema i iakynduh ia u ksew ba kyrteng Moti."Ngam ju lah ban khie haka por mynstep. Long phin kyrsiew ia nga?" I Bheema i kylli ia u Moti! "Hooid, toa," ong u Moti, bad haka step kaba bud u wiar bad u wiar hynrei i Bheema i khlem khie? Em!

Ha kato ka janmiet i Bheema i iakynduh ia ka siar-ryngkuh ka Chenu. I ong ia ka Chenu, "Phi ju kynih haka step bad baroh ki ju iakhie. Long phin kyrsiew ia nga ruh?" Ka Chenu ka kohnguh. Haka step kaba bud, ka Chenu ka pah eh bad jam bha, hynrei i Bheema i khlem khie.

Haka janmiet ba bud, i Bheema i iohi iaka Kalu, ka tyngab, haba ka pah sngewbha. "Kalu long phin sngewbha ban kyrsiew ia nga mynstep?" ong i Bheema. Ka Kalu ka ong, "Balei em? Ngan sa pah bad kyrsiew ia phi." Haka step kaba bud ka Kalu ka pah katba lah hynrei i Bheema i khlem khie.
I Bheema i sngewsih. Haka step ba bud, u skaiñ u wan bad u shong haka khmut jong i."Aaah...shhoooo...ahshhoo!" i Bheema i khie bad ka jingsynriah kaba heh.

"Waw! Nga lah khie. Kumno nga khie?" i kylli da kabym sngewthuh. "Nga kyrsiew ia phi," ong u skaiñ. "Long phin kyrsiew ia nga kumne man ka step?" "Kalong," ong u skaiñ. I Bheema i la sngewkmen. Mynta i nym don jingeh shuh ban khie mynstep man ka step!

eng: Every day after school, Manu plays hopscotch.She jumps and counts.1, 2, and 3.4, 5, and 6.7, 8, 9, and 10.
But today Manu is feeling itchy-scratchyon her tummy. She jumps and counts.1, 2, and 3.SCRATCH!4, 5, and 6.SCRATCH! SCRATCH!7, 8, 9, and 10.SCRATCH! SCRATCH! SCRATCH!
“You have chickenpox,” says Amma.“You cannot go to school.”
Manu plops herself on the bed and goes,SCRATCH!SCRATCH! SCRATCH!SCRATCH! SCRATCH! SCRATCH!
“Do not scratch!” says Amma.It makes Manu evenmore itchy-scratchy!
When Amma and Baba are not looking,SCRATCH!After eating porridge,SCRATCH! SCRATCH!
“Do not scratch!”yell Amma and Baba.
But when she lies onthe bed, again she goes,SCRATCH!SCRATCH! SCRATCH!SCRATCH! SCRATCH!SCRATCH!
Manu tries and tries not toSCRATCH! SCRATCH!She plays snakesand ladders.She dreams up many stories.She forgets to SCRATCH! SCRATCH!

Slowly, the bumps disappear. Manu counts.10, 9, and 8. 7, 6, and 5. 4, 3, 2, and 1.
Until one day Manu pulls her shirt up.All the itchy-scratchy bumps are...GONE!
Now Manu can play hopscotch.She jumps and counts.1, 2, and 3.4, 5, and 6.7, 8, 9, and 10.
kha: Man ka sngi da lah wai skul,I Manu i lehkai sohtyngkoh.I kynthih bad i ñiew.1,2, bad 3.4,5, bad 6.7,8, 9, bad 10.
Hynrei mynta ka sngi i Manu i sngew dait ka kpoh.I kynthih bad i ñiew .1,2, bad 3. Trut!4,5, bad 6. Trut! Trut!7,8,9, bad 10. Trut! Trut! Trut

Suki, suki ki khñiang ki jah noh. I Manu i ñiew. 10,9, bad 8,7,6, bad 5,4,3,2, bad 1.Haduh kawei ka sngi i Manu i khlied ka sopti shajrong. Baroh ki jing-dait khñiang ki lah...JAH!
Mynta i Manu i la lah ban ialehkai sohtyngkoh.I kynthih bad ñiew.1,2, bad 3.4,5, bad 6.7,8,9,bad 10.

eng: Bread pakoda is a triangle.
Vada is a ring.
Pomfret is a hexagon,when cut from the middle.
Dosa is a cone, when folded from the end.
Halwa has no shape. It takes the shape you give it.
They all come together and become a food monster.
I chase the food monster aroundthe plate.And eat it with a chomp, a crunch, a crackle and a smack!

eng: Nothing goes to waste in a forest. Nothing at all!Everything gets cleaned up. Absolutely everything!
When leopards don’t finish their food,Who eats the rest?The vultures and the hyenas!
And the hungry wild boar.GRUNT! GRUNT!
When the vultures and the hyenas waste their food,Who gobbles it up?The flies and the maggots!
And the hungry wild boar.GRUNT! GRUNT!
When elephants poop in the forest,Who snacks on that?The dung beetles!
And the hungry wild boar.GRUNT! GRUNT!
When branches, leaves, and rain fall on the ground,Who feasts on it all?The termites and the fungi!
And the hungry wild boar.GRUNT! GRUNT!
When the air gets dirty with smoke,Who sucks it all in?The trees!
Ummm, but not the hungry wild boar.GRUNT! GRUNT!

eng: “I can’t lift you up, Shanu!” says Ammi. “You are too big!”

“You can’t walk 
to school alone, Shanu!” says Abbu. “You are too small!”
“You can’t sleep in the baby’s cot, Shanu!” says Dadu. “You are too big!”
“You can’t carry the baby to the park, Shanu!” says Dadi. “You are too small!”
Shanu is puzzled. Too big! Too small! How can she be too big andtoo small all at once?
Too big to wear her old pink frock.Too small to make dosas at the stove.
Too big to climb up on Dadu’s back?Too smallto carry the baby on hers?
“What am I the right size for?” Shanu wonders.
“And you are just small enough for me to carry you on my shoulders,” says Abbu.
“You are just big enough to take me for my morning walks,” says Dadu.
“And you are just small enough for me to tell stories to,” says Dadi.

“And you will always, always be the perfect size...
for this!" all say, 
and give 
her a warm, wonderful hug.
kha: "Ngam lah ban rah ia phi Shanu!" ong i Mei."Phi lah heh palat!"

"Phim lah ban thiah ha jingthiah khyllung!" ong i parad."Phi lah heh palat!"
"Phim lah ban rah ia i khyllung sha jaka lehkai, Shanu!" ong i Meirad."Phi dang rit palat!"
I Shanu im sngewthuh shuh.Heh palat! Rit palat!Kumno i lah ban long iba heh palat bad iba rit palat haka juh ka por?
Heh palat ban phong ka sopti jong i ba pink.Rit palat ban shna dosa ha ka nar sliew ding.
Heh palat ban kiew ha dien jong i Parad?Rit palat ban bah ia i khyllung?
"Nga long iba iahap ban leh aiu?"I Shanu i pyrkhat.
"Bad phi long iba dang rit ba ngan rah ia phi ha ki tyrpeng jong nga," ong i Pa.
"Phi lah heh ban long i ban ialam ia nga ban leit iaidkai step," ong i Parad.
"Bad phi dang rit ba ngan ioh iathuh khana," ong i Meirad.
"Bad phi long borabor iba dei ban ioh ia kane!" ki la ia ong baroh,bad ki la ia kdup ia i daka jingieid.

eng: My name is Shyam, I am ten years old. i'm a little skinny, but very bold!Waking up for school is no fun at allso sleepy as I get up, I think i might fall!
My eyes close as I begin to brush,I hear mom making dosas in a rush.My mind slowly wanders away,and many, many ideas come into play.
What is my neck was ten times as long?half in school, half at home, where would I belong?
What if my legs were as tall as trees?My school building would only come up to my knees!
What if my arms were strong enough ?Then, lifting Mumma would not be tough!
What if there was nothing too hard for my teeth ?Just think of all the things I could eat!
What if my belly were as round as could be ?All my friends could jump and bounce off me!
What if I had big and floppy ears?I could hear everything, far and near!
I find myself still standing with my brush in my hand, And I smile and think of my secret little land.

eng: Baba is making coconut chutney.“Huh! Where did the coconut shell go?”
Aapa wants to paint the sky.“Oh! Where did the blue paint go?”
Ammi is going to solve the crossword puzzle.“Huh! Where did the newspaper go?”
Daadi’s needle moves like magic through the clothes.“Oh! Where did the buttons go?”
“The house is too quiet,” says Baba.“Ameena must be up to something.”

“I am making an alien!” Ameena smiles.“Oh! So that is what Ameena was up to!” says Aapa.

eng: Tara and Ravi are going to the market.Amma has given them a list of fruitsand vegetables to buy. At the market, Tara spots juicy red tomatoes. "I hope Amma makes tomato chutney today," she says.
Tara and Ravi walk home singing: "We want ... Tomato chutney, tomato chutney. Amma's tasty tomato chutney!"

Suddenly Ravi asks Tara,"Is something dripping on your feet too?" Their bag is wet. Oh no! The tomatoes are all squashed at the bottom. Tara whispers to Ravi,"Our tomato chutney looks so horrible.Not at all like Amma's!"

The next week, Tara and Ravi are careful. "Heavy vegetables at the bottom; soft and light ones on top," Ravi keeps repeating. Into the bag goes: - 1 watermelon- ½ kg potatoes- 1 coconut- ½ kg grapes- 6 raw bananas- ½ kg tomatoes, right on top.

But at home, they find the grapes have become grape juice under the raw bananas! "Last time we made the tomatoes into chutney. This time we made the grapes into juice. Wonder what we will do next!" Tara says sadly.
Next time, Amma's list also has oranges. They are soft and light. So they go on top, next to the tomatoes.
Just as Tara and Ravi are walking home singing their chutney song, their friends see them. They are thirsty, so they eat up all the oranges!
At home, Amma hugs them when she hears about the missing oranges. She tells them not to feel sad.
Next week, Tara and Ravi are clever.They hide the oranges under the lightest thing -a bunch of pudina leaves. Now their thirsty friends will not spot the oranges!
That night, Amma makes her tasty tomato chutneyand lemon rice. Tara and Ravi gobble up their dinner. And what do they get later? Sweet, juicy oranges, of course!
1. If your mother sent you to the shop to buy apples, watermelon and bananas, which fruit would you NEVER put at the bottom?
2. Your shopping bag has ½ kg sugar, ½ kg tea, and two packets of biscuits. Which one goes on top?

3. Ravi is going to the shop one morning to get half a dozen eggs, ½ kg onions, 1 loaf of bread and ¼ kg potatoes.

"Be careful of the eggs!" Amma calls out. 

Which other items should Ravi NOT pack at the bottom of the bag?
kha:
I Tara bad i Ravi ki dang ia leit ïew.I Mei i la ai ia ki, ki kyrteng ia kiei ban thied na ki jhur bad ki soh.Ha ka 

ïew, i Tara i la iohi ia ki sohsaw ba i shngiam bha. "Nga kyrmen ba i Mei in shet shitini sohsaw mynta ka sngi," i ong.
I Tara bad i Ravi ki ia iaid sha ïing bad ki ia rwai artad:"Ngi ia kwah...Shitini sohsaw, shitini sohsaw.Shitini sohsaw jong i Mei!"

t all like Amma's!"

Kynsan i Ravi i kylli ia i Tara,"Don eiei ba jaw ha ka kjat jong phi ruh?"Ka pla jong ki ka jhieh, Oh ho! Ki sohsaw ki lah jem lut hapoh.I Tara i pasiaw ia i Ravi,"Ki sohsaw jong ngi ki i sniew bha.Ym kum jong i Mei la kumno kumno ruh!"

Haka taiew ba wan, i Tara bad i Ravi ki la ia leh bha."Ki jhur ba khia hapoh; ki ba jem bad kiba sting hajrong," i Ravi i ong shi ong.Ha ka pla don:1 watermelon1/2 kg u phan1 snepkor1/2 kg u soh grape6 tylli u kait1/2 kg u sohsaw, ha jrong duh.

Hynrei ha ïing, ki shem ba ki soh grape ki lah long kum ka umsoh hapoh ki kait ba im!"Mynshuwa ngi ia pynlong iaki sohsaw sha u shitini. Ha kane ka por ngi ia pynlong ia u soh grape sha u umsoh. Nga pyrkhat ngin ialeh aiu pat hadien!" ong i Tara da kaba sngewsih.
Haka sien kaba hadien, I Mei i phah thied sohñiamtra ruh.Ki long kiba jem bad kiba sting. Te ki leit shajrong bad ki sohsaw.

Kat haba i Tara bad i Ravi ki dang iaiaid sha ïing bad katba ki iarwai artad ia ka jingrwai shitini jong ki, ki paralok jong ki, ki iohi ia ki.Ki la thrang um, te ki la ia bam lut ia ki sohñiamtra jong ki.
Ha ïing, i Mei i kdup ia ki haba i iohsngew shaphang ki sohñiamtra ba la jah.I ong iaki ban nym sngewsih.

Ha ka taiew ba wan, i Tara bad i Ravi ki ia sian.Ki iabuhrieh iaki sohñiamtra hapoh kiei kiei kiba sting tam-Ha ki sla pudina. Mynta ki paralok jong ki kibathrang umkin nym iohi shuh iaki sohñiamtra jong ki.
Ha kato ka miet, i Mei i shet iaka shitini sohsaw bad ja lemon ba bang bha. I Tara bad i Ravi ki ia bam ia ka jingbam jong ki.Bad ia kaei de ki ioh hadien? Ki Sohñiamtra ba thiang bad ba shngiam bha!
1. Lada i Mei jong phi i phah ia phi ban leit theid jingthied na dukan ia u soh apul, watermelon, bad ka kait, ia uei u soh phin nym buh hapoh-duh?
2. Ka pla ïew jong phi kadon 1/2 kg ka shini, 1/2 kg u sla sha, bad ar song u biskit. Uno un leit shajrong?

3. I Ravi i leit thied jingthied na dukan ha kawei ka step ban leit thied shiteng dorjon u pylleng, 1/2 kg u piat, uwei u ruti bad 1/4 kg u phan."Da peit bha ia ki pylleng!" i ong i Mei.Ia kiei de ki jingthied ba i Ravi im dei ban buh hapoh-duh ka pla?

are Dadi's red chillies, don't touch them!

lemons.

eat something colourful too! Yummy! Should we eat a pink chuski?

kha: Kine ki dei ki sohmynken saw jong i Meikha,wat nym ktah ia ki!
Aha, i Bholu i dang ot sohbaingon basaw bthuh.
I kongkong Rani i don ki sohjew kiba shai stem.
Ki rong ki long kiba sngewbha ban ia peit kai. Mynta ngin ia bam kaei kaei ba don rong ruh! Ia ngin ia bam i chuski ba rong pink?
Ngi lah ban dih ka jingdih jira ba khlain bad ba jyrngam.
Jyrngam nabar, pink napoh, bad ka mluh kaba lieh kaba shida, bad u powdar sohmynken saw.

eng: “I can’t lift you up, Shanu!” says Ammi. “You are too big!”

“You can’t walk 
to school alone, Shanu!” says Abbu. “You are too small!”
“You can’t sleep in the baby’s cot, Shanu!” says Dadu. “You are too big!”
“You can’t carry the baby to the park, Shanu!” says Dadi. “You are too small!”
Shanu is puzzled. Too big! Too small! How can she be too big andtoo small all at once?
Too big to wear her old pink frock.Too small to make dosas at the stove.
Too big to climb up on Dadu’s back?Too smallto carry the baby on hers?
“What am I the right size for?” Shanu wonders.
“And you are just small enough for me to carry you on my shoulders,” says Abbu.
“You are just big enough to take me for my morning walks,” says Dadu.
“And you are just small enough for me to tell stories to,” says Dadi.

“And you will always, always be the perfect size...
for this!" all say, 
and give 
her a warm, wonderful hug.
kha: "Ngam lah ban rah ia phi Shanu!" ong i Mei."Phi lah heh palat!"
"Phim lah ban iaid marwei sha skul Shanu!" ong i Pa."Phi dang rit palat!"
"Phim lah ban thiah ha jingthiah khyllung!" ong i parad."Phi lah heh palat!"
"Phim lah ban rah ia i khyllung sha jaka lehkai, Shanu!" ong i Meirad."Phi dang rit palat!"
I Shanu im sngewthuh shuh.Heh palat! Rit palat!Kumno i lah ban long iba heh palat bad iba rit palat haka juh ka por?
Heh palat ban phong ka sopti jong i ba pink.Rit palat ban shna dosa ha ka nar sliew ding.
Heh palat ban kiew ha dien jong i Parad?Rit palat ban bah ia i khyllung?
"Nga long iba iahap ban leh aiu?"I Shanu i pyrkhat.
"Bad phi long iba dang rit ba ngan rah ia phi ha ki tyrpeng jong nga," ong i Pa.
"Phi lah heh ban long i ban ialam ia nga ban leit iaidkai step," ong i Parad.
"Bad phi dang rit ba ngan ioh iathuh khana," ong i Meirad.
"Bad phi long borabor iba dei ban ioh ia kane!" ki la ia ong baroh,bad ki la ia kdup ia i daka jingieid.

eng: “What should we make for lunch today?” asks Paati.“Let’s make rainbow sambar!” says Bhavya.“How do you make rainbow sambar?” asks Paati.“I’ll show you,” says Bhavya.
Crispy violet sambar onions
Plump indigo brinjal
Skinny green drumsticks
Round yellow toor dal
Crunchy orange carrots
Juicy red tomatoes
Wash them, chop them. Put them in a pot. Add sweet and sour golden-brown tamarind and spicy yellow sambar powder.
Fry them.Stir them.Let them sizzle and simmer.
That’s how you make rainbow sambar!
kha: "Ngin ia shet aiu ban bamja step mynta ka sngi?" kylli i Paati."Ia ngin ia shet ia u sambar simpyllieng!" ong i Bhavya."Kumno phi shet ia u sambar simpyllieng?" kylli i Paati."Ngan pyni ia phi," ong i Bhavya.
Ki piat sambar kiba shroiñ kiba saw bthuh
Ki sohbaingon kiba pyllon kiba rong lir
Ki jhur drumstick ba raikhoh ba jyrngam
U Dai tur uba pyllun uba stem
Kajor kiba rong soh kiba shroiñ
Ki sohsaw kiba shngiam kiba saw
Sait ia ki, ot lyngkhot ia ki. Buh ia ki ha u khiew. Ai ia u sohkyntoi uba rong ksiar bad uba saw bthuh, uba thiang bad uba jew, bad ia u powdar sambar uba sat bad uba stem.
Sdieh ia ki.Kieng ia ki.Ai ba kin thnam bad ba kin ih bha.
Phi shet ia u sambar simpyllieng kumne!

eng: One day, Gauri, the cow, asked him, “Bheema, why are you so sad?”Bheema said, “I cannot get up early and Ramu shouts at me every day. Will you wake me up every morning, please?”“Yes, I will,” said Gauri. Early next morning, Gauri mooed loudly, but Bheema did not wake up.

Coming back from the river in the evening, Bheema met Moti, the dog.“I can never get up in the morning on time. Will you wake me up?” Bheema asked Moti.“Yes, I will,” said Moti and the next morning he barked and barked but did Bheema did not wake up.

That evening Bheema met Cheenu, the rooster.He said to Cheenu, “You crow in the morning and everybody wakes up. Will you wake me up too?” Cheenu agreed. The next morning, Cheenu crowed long and loud, but Bheema did not wake up.

The next evening, Bheema saw Kalu, the crow, cawing away happily.“Kalu, will you wake me up in the morning, please?” he asked.Kalu said, “Why not? I will caw and wake you up.”The next morning Kalu cawed all he could but Bheema did not wake up.
Bheema was sad.The next morning, a fly came and sat on his nose.“Aaah…chhoooo… ahchhoo!” Bheema got up with a big sneeze.

“Wow! I woke up. How did I wake up?” he asked in wonder.“I woke you up,” said the fly.“Will you wake me up like this early every morning?” “Sure,” said the fly. Bheema was happy. Now he would have no problem getting up early every morning!
kha: Ha kawei ka sngi, ka masi ba kyrteng Gauri, ka kylli ia i,"Bheema, balei phi sngewsih?"I Bheema i ong, "Ngam lah ban khie dang step bad i Ramu i hala ia nga man ka sngi. Sngewbha, long phin kyrsiew ia nga man ka step?" "Hooid toa," ong i Gauri. Ha ka sngi ba bud, mynstep, I Gauri i pah jam bha, hynrei i Bheema i khlem khie.

? No Sir!Haba i dang wan na ka wah por janmiet, i Bheema i iakynduh ia u ksew ba kyrteng Moti."Ngam ju lah ban khie haka por mynstep. Long phin kyrsiew ia nga?" I Bheema i kylli ia u Moti! "Hooid, toa," ong u Moti, bad haka step kaba bud u wiar bad u wiar hynrei i Bheema i khlem khie? Em!

Ha kato ka janmiet i Bheema i iakynduh ia ka siar-ryngkuh ka Chenu. I ong ia ka Chenu, "Phi ju kynih haka step bad baroh ki ju iakhie. Long phin kyrsiew ia nga ruh?" Ka Chenu ka kohnguh. Haka step kaba bud, ka Chenu ka pah eh bad jam bha, hynrei i Bheema i khlem khie.

Haka janmiet ba bud, i Bheema i iohi iaka Kalu, ka tyngab, haba ka pah sngewbha. "Kalu long phin sngewbha ban kyrsiew ia nga mynstep?" ong i Bheema. Ka Kalu ka ong, "Balei em? Ngan sa pah bad kyrsiew ia phi." Haka step kaba bud ka Kalu ka pah katba lah hynrei i Bheema i khlem khie.
I Bheema i sngewsih. Haka step ba bud, u skaiñ u wan bad u shong haka khmut jong i."Aaah...shhoooo...ahshhoo!" i Bheema i khie bad ka jingsynriah kaba heh.

"Waw! Nga lah khie. Kumno nga khie?" i kylli da kabym sngewthuh. "Nga kyrsiew ia phi," ong u skaiñ. "Long phin kyrsiew ia nga kumne man ka step?" "Kalong," ong u skaiñ. I Bheema i la sngewkmen. Mynta i nym don jingeh shuh ban khie mynstep man ka step!

eng:
“La-la,
la, la, la, la, la…”
“Is it from somewhere?” “Is it from everywhere?”“It is from there!”

“La-la,
la, la, la, la, la…”
“Is it from the sky?”“Is it from the tree?”“It is from the bush!”
“La-la, la, la, la, la, la…”
“Is it black?”“Is it white?”“It is brown!”
“La-la, la, la, la, la, laa …”
“Is it a prayer?”“Is it a poem?”“It is a song!”
“Is it a koyal?”“Is it a myna?”“It is a…”
“La-la, la, la, la, la, la…”
“It is a donkey!”“It is a donkey!”“It is a donkey, sing on!”

eng: The painters were busy. One painter was on a ladder. Another was hanging from the roof on a swing. “Can we help?” asked Veena and Vinay.
The painter gave each of them a brush. “Paint the inside of the gate,” he said to Veena. “Paint the outside of the gate,” he said to Vinay.
The paint fell on the ground. The paint fell on the wall. The paint fell on them.
At last they finished. They wiped off the paint that had splashed on the ground. They wiped off the paint that had splashed on the wall.
“Oh, you have made a two-coloured gate!” cried the painter. “Let us keep it that way!” said Mother.
kha: Ki nongñiad rong ki bunkam. Iwei i nongñiad rong i don haka jingkieng dieng. Iwei pat i sdien na ka sat jong ka sohpadoi. "Long ngin iarap?" kylli i Veena bad Vinay.
U nongñiad rong u ai iwei i brut iaki baroh arngut. "Ñiad iaka ba hapoh ka phalor," u ong ia Veena."Ñiad iaka habar ka phalor," u ong ia Vinay.
Ka rong ka hap hapoh madan.Ka rong ka hap ha ka kynroh,Ka rong ka hap ha ki.
Haba khatduh ki la ia dep. Ki sa ñiad iaka rong ba la hap ha madan. Ki ñiad iaka rong ba la hap ha kynroh.
"Oh, peit phi la shna ka phalor ba ar rong!" ong u nongñiad rong."Ia ngin iabuh beit iaka kumto!" ong i Mei.

eng: “What happened dear?Did you call me?” asks Ma.
I point towards the tiger. Ma bends and pulls the tiger out from under the bed!
Hey, this is no tiger. This is my thick yellow and black sweater. Its buttons shine like a tiger's eyes.
I got scared for nothing!Ma gets me some water.
kha: "Jia aiu baieid? Phi khot ne ia nga? kylli i Mei.
Nga kdew shaphang u khla . I mei i la dem bad i la tan ia u khla napoh khrum jingthiah!
Ei! une um dei re u khla. Kane kadei ka swetar rben stem bad ïong jong nga. Ki budam jong ka ki shai kum ki khmat u khla.
Nga lah shu tieng kai ia ka bym dei eiei!Mei pynai um lem sieh ia nga.

eng: It's not easy being a tiger.Yes, tigers are beautiful and fierce.
But tigers are also big and heavy.This makes it difficult for them to hunt for food.
Out of every twenty times a tiger hunts,it eats only once.
When a tiger moves through the forest,KHAU! KHAU! KHAK!The langur calls, just like an old man coughing!KHAU! KHAU! KHAK!
AWOOOO! HAWOOOO!The barking deer calls, like a scared dog!AWOOOO! HAWOOOO!
OOW! OOW! OOW!The spotted deer calls, like a little bird!OOW! OOW! OOW!
The whole forest knows the tiger is here!AHUUUN? AHUUUN?The tiger wonders, where has everyone gone?
kha: Kam long kaba suk ban dei u khla,Hooid, ki khla kilong kiba itynnad bad kiba dom.
Hynrei ki khla kilong ruh kiba heh bad kiba khia.Kane ka pynjynjar ia ki ban wad iaka jingbam.
Shisien na ka arphew sien ba u khla u leit wad jingbam,u ioh bam tang shisien.
Haba u khla u iaid ha ka khlaw, KHAU! KAHU! KHAK!U Shrieh u khot, kum u tymmen briew ba jyrhoh! KHAU! KHAU! KHAK!

AWOOOO! HAWOOOO!Ka skei ka khot, kum u ksew uba sheptieng! 

AWOOOO! HAWOOOO!

OOW! OOW! OOW!ka skei ka khot, kum i sim barit! 

OOW! OOW! OOW!
Baroh kawei ka khlaw ka lah tip ba u khla u lah don hangne! AHUUUN? AHUUUN?U Khla u pyrkhat, shaei baroh ki la leit?

eng: Susheela resides in Tamilnadu. She learnt to draw Kolams  from her mother.
kha: I Susheela i sah ha Tamil Nadu. I tip ban dro kolam na i Mei jong i.

eng: For the very first time, Maaloo is collecting vegetables from the garden. He has collected red tomatoes, fresh brinjals and green lady's fingers.
Maaloo looked at all the trees, creepers and plants. Not a single potato could he see.
“Dadi, the potatoes aren’t ready yet,” said Maaloo, putting the empty basket down. “No Maaloo, there are plenty of potatoes. Look carefully,” said Dadi.
Maaloo went into the garden once more. Kaaloo followed him. Maaloo was looking for potatoes when he heard, “Woof! Woof!”
“Kaaloo! Stop, Kaaloo!” yelled Maaloo, running behind him. “Don’t spoil the garden.” Maaloo saw that Kaaloo was digging away and what do you think was coming out of the mud?Big fat potatoes!
“Well done, Kaaloo. You found the potatoes!” laughed Maaloo, filling his basket with potatoes.
kha: Haka sien kaba nyngkong eh. i Maaloo i dang kheit jhur na ka kper. I lah kheit ki sohsaw kiba saw, ki sohbaingon kiba i bha bad ki byndi kiba jyrngam.
I Maaloo i peit ia baroh ki dieng, ki siej, bad ki jingthung. Um don iwei ruh i phan ba i lah ban iohi.
"Meirad, ki phan kim pat long ban kheit," la ong i Maaloo, haba i buh ia ka shang ka bym don eiei ha madan."Em Maaloo, ki don bun ki phan. Peit bha," la ong i Meirad.
I Maaloo i leit biang sha ka kper sa shisien. I Kaaloo ruh i bud ia i. I Maaloo i dang wad ia ki phan haba i iohsngew, ka jingwiar ksew!

"Kaaloo! Sangeh, Kaaloo!" i hala i Maaloo, haba i dang mareh nadien. "Wat pynduh iaka kper." I Maaloo i la iohi ba i Kaaloo i dang tih bad phi tharai i iohi aiu ba mih nabar ka ktieh? Ki phan baheh ba sngaid!
"Ish, Kaaloo. Phi la ioh iaki phan!" i rkhie i Maaloo, haba i pyndap iaka shang jong i da ki phan.
